column4: My neighbor just gave me his old Pentium II 233Mgh with 32Mb RAM.  I would like to do a Linux install.    How can I find out what type of RAM I need to upgrade and how much would you recommend.  I have 3 available slots.
It would depend on the motherboard.  Find out what type of mobo you have, do a google search for it, and see what type of ram it takes and how much it can support
I opened the tower.  How can I find out what type of mother board?  Is there a serial number or something?

Yes, generally there is going to be a brand an type somewhere on the board.  Usually located near either the cpu socket or the ram.  Barring that there will be at least a serial number on it.   If that fails you can at least check what type of ram is already in there.
